text: Bobby decides to be that “ Special Somebody.”  He takes the items near the door, goes outside and walks to the sewer opening at the bottom of the street.  “SCCRRUUNCCH CRRRUUNNCCHH” is all Bobby hears the closer he gets to the sewer opening. “What is that sound?” he thinks and realizes it’s all the soda cans he has been stepping on. Finally Bobby gets to the sewer. “WHOOOOSSHH” he opens his bag, and starts picking up the trash.
When he's done he looks up the street and sees how much cleaner it looks. The trees can now see their feet, and Bobby can now walk on the spongy grass without stepping on a plastic bag or soda can.”
Bobby continues to do this once a week for a couple weeks.
His neighbor from the other side of street, Asia, comes out and says, ‘What are you doing?”
Bobby responds, “Im being a special somebody that  helps fix  up the city, since people think that it’s dirty.”,
“I want to be a special somebody. I’ll help you pick up trash,” exclaims Asia.
Bobby hands Asia a trash bag and goes to work on her side of the street.

As time went on more and more people wanted to be ”that special somebody”. Word spread from street to block to neighborhood to the whole city. Less trash was thrown on the street, and more people recycled.
Cleaner streets encouraged more people to ride their bikes.
People stopped throwing trash on Bobby’s steps, so Mother extended her garden to the front.
Can you be “that special somebody” on your street?
